New Records: Jordan Walker hit the third-youngest five-hit game in Cardinals history
The Cardinals set season highs for runs (14) and hits (21)
The Cardinals finished with at least 20 hits for the first time since Sept. 1, 2020
Key Match Events: Lars Nootbaar hit a bases-clearing two-strike double in the seventh
Nootbaar added a two-run homer in the ninth
Victor Scott II hit an RBI double and scored on a throwing error by Phil Bickford
Anthony Rizzo hit an RBI double to start a three-run fifth
Luken Baker hit a two-run homer in the fourth
JoJo Romero retired Soto to end the sixth
Pre-Game Insights: The Yankees' lead in the American League East over Baltimore was trimmed to a half-game
St. Louis had double-digit hits for the sixth time and seven games
St. Louis starter Miles Mikolas allowed five runs (three earned) and seven hits in four-plus innings
Cortes allowed five runs and nine hits in four innings
Post-Match Reflections: Walker expressed pride in the team's resilience after the comeback win
Manager Oliver Marmol highlighted Walker's performance
Miscellaneous Highlights: Walker hit a long two-run homer in the fifth
Nootbaar's hit went over Juan Soto's head
Rizzo hit an RBI double to start a three-run fifth
Verdugo and Torres had run-scoring singles
Stanton homered and Chisholm Jr. scored on an error
Judge remained at 51 homers, going homerless for the sixth straight game
Others: JoJo Romero (6-2) retired Soto to end the sixth
Steven Matz was activated after completing his rehab from a back injury
Luis Gil (lower back strain) threw 80 pitches in 3 2/3 innings in a rehab game
